channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jeff Bezos Just Re-Entered the C-Suite With a $6 Billion AI Bet
item.description: His new venture, Project Prometheus, is targeting industrial automation to modernize American manufacturing.

item.title: ‘Quiet, Piggy’: Trump’s viral insult has already become an anti-MAGA clapback
item.description: Pigs famously have thick skin and Donald Trump does not. It’s just one of myriad distinctions between the cloven-hoofed barnyard animal and America’s ...

item.title: Data centers are surging—but so are the protests against them
item.description: Across the country, data center demand and construction have been skyrocketing throughout 2025. And so has local opposition to those projects. From In...

item.title: Microsoft partners with Anthropic and Nvidia on cloud infrastructure deal, shifting further away from OpenAI
item.description: Microsoft said Tuesday it is partnering with artificial intelligence company Anthropic and chipmaker Nvidia as part of a cloud infrastructure deal tha...

item.title: House votes 427-1 to release Epstein files in remarkable rebuke to Trump
item.description: Both President Trump and Speaker Mike Johnson failed in their efforts to prevent the vote

item.title: An AI-powered teddy bear explained match-lighting and sexual roleplay
item.description: As we head into the holiday season, toys with generative AI chatbots in them may start appearing on Christmas lists. A concerning report found one inn...

item.title: ‘Bond King’ Jeffrey Gundlach warns of the next financial crisis: ‘It has the same trappings as subprime mortgage repackaging in 2006’
item.description: The billionaire founder of DoubleLine Capital is also convinced the $38 trillion national debt will be addressed before 2030: "something has to happen...

item.title: Meta Just Prevailed in its Historic FTC Antitrust Case
item.description: Meta beat back an existential challenge to its business. It won’t have to spin off WhatsApp and Instagram.

item.title: NPR to get $36 million in government funds to operate U.S. public radio system
item.description: National Public Radio will receive approximately $36 million in grant money to operate the nation’s public radio interconnection system under the term...

item.title: Meta prevails in historic FTC antitrust case, won’t have to break up WhatsApp, Instagram
item.description: U.S. District Judge James Boasberg issued his ruling Tuesday after the historic antitrust trial wrapped up in late May.

item.title: Google’s New Gemini 3 AI Crushed OpenAI and Anthropic in a Benchmark Test for Business Operations
item.description: Gemini 3 is finally here. Google says that’s its both good at running a business and less sycophantic, too.

item.title: Exclusive: Crypto exchange Kraken raises $200 million from Ken Griffin’s Citadel Securities to notch $20 billion valuation
item.description: Once skittish about digital assets, Citadel has warmed towards the crypto business in 2025.

item.title: U.S. stocks follow Asia, Europe down on fear that Nvidia, other superstars are overvalued
item.description: After quickly sliding to a morning loss of 1.5%, the S&P 500 clawed back nearly all of it before sinking again. It finished with a fall of 0.8%.

item.title: Penny Shortage Forces Major Grocery Chain to Buy the Coins From Customers at Twice Their Value
